p: The total phenol content assessed through Folin-Ciocalteu assay is reported in Fig.Â 3(C,D). Generally, unripe fruits are up to 2.3 times richer in polyphenols than the ripe ones (i.e. P. serotina aqueous extracts). Although L. japonica and P. americana extracts were not as rich in polyphenols as V. myrtillus, the hydro-alcoholic extraction enhanced their quantity, especially in the case of the latter species.
